You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 35
segments.en: Linked Discourses 35

segments.pli: 18. Samuddavagga
segments.en: 18. The Ocean

segments.pli: 233. Kāmabhūsutta
segments.en: 233. With Kāmabhū

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca ānando āyasmā ca kāmabhū kosambiyaṃ viharanti ghositārāme.
segments.en: At one time the venerables Ānanda and Kāmabhū were staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā kāmabhū sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā ānandena saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Kāmabhū came out of retreat, went to Venerable Ānanda, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā kāmabhū āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Ānanda:

segments.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso ānanda, cakkhu rūpānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, rūpā cakkhussa saṃyojanaṃ … pe …
segments.en: “Reverend Ānanda, which is it? Is the eye the fetter of sights, or are sights the fetter of the eye?

segments.pli: jivhā rasānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, rasā jivhāya saṃyojanaṃ … pe …
segments.en: Is the ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: mano dhammānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, dhammā manassa saṃyojanan”ti?
segments.en: mind the fetter of thoughts, or are thoughts the fetter of the mind?”

segments.pli: “Na kho, āvuso kāmabhū, cakkhu rūpānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, na rūpā cakkhussa saṃyojanaṃ.
segments.en: “Reverend Kāmabhū, the eye is not the fetter of sights, nor are sights the fetter of the eye.

segments.pli: Yañca tattha tadubhayaṃ paṭicca uppajjati chandarāgo, taṃ tattha saṃyojanaṃ … pe …
segments.en: The fetter there is the desire and greed that arises from the pair of them.

segments.pli: na jivhā rasānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, na rasā jivhāya saṃyojanaṃ … pe …
segments.en: The ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: na mano dhammānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, na dhammā manassa saṃyojanaṃ.
segments.en: mind is not the fetter of thoughts, nor are thoughts the fetter of the mind.

segments.pli: Yañca tattha tadubhayaṃ paṭicca uppajjati chandarāgo taṃ tattha saṃyojanaṃ.
segments.en: The fetter there is the desire and greed that arises from the pair of them.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, kāḷo ca balībaddo odāto ca balībaddo ekena dāmena vā yottena vā saṃyuttā assu.
segments.en: Suppose there was a black ox and a white ox yoked by a single harness or yoke.

segments.pli: Yo nu kho evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Would it be right to say that

segments.pli: ‘kāḷo balībaddo odātassa balībaddassa saṃyojanaṃ, odāto balībaddo kāḷassa balībaddassa saṃyojanan’ti, sammā nu kho so vadamāno vadeyyā”ti?
segments.en: the black ox is the yoke of the white ox, or the white ox is the yoke of the black ox?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, āvuso”.
segments.en: “No, reverend.

segments.pli: “Na kho, āvuso, kāḷo balībaddo odātassa balībaddassa saṃyojanaṃ, napi odāto balībaddo kāḷassa balībaddassa saṃyojanaṃ.
segments.en: The black ox is not the yoke of the white ox, nor is the white ox the yoke of the black ox.

segments.pli: Yena ca kho te ekena dāmena vā yottena vā saṃyuttā, taṃ tattha saṃyojanaṃ.
segments.en: The yoke there is the single harness or yoke that they’re yoked by.”

segments.pli: Evameva kho, āvuso, na cakkhu rūpānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, na rūpā cakkhussa saṃyojanaṃ … pe …
segments.en: “In the same way, the eye is not the fetter of sights, nor are sights the fetter of the eye.

segments.pli: na jivhā … pe …
segments.en: The ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: na mano … pe …
segments.en: mind is not the fetter of thoughts, nor are thoughts the fetter of the mind.

segments.pli: yañca tattha tadubhayaṃ paṭicca uppajjati chandarāgo, taṃ tattha saṃyojanan”ti.
segments.en: The fetter there is the desire and greed that arises from the pair of them.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the venerables Ānanda and Kāmabhū were…

suttaplex.blurb: Kāmabhū asks Ānanda whether the interior and exterior sense fields are the fetters of each other. No; it is desire that is the fetter. One with no desire still experiences the senses but without fetters.
